intro: Tibouchina pilosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic shrubs and trees. Tibouchina pilosa typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
